text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Nagamine was born in Kodaira on 3 June 1968. She played for Shinko Seiko FC Clair until 1990. She was selected Best Eleven in 1990 season. In 1991, she moved to Italian club Reggiana Refrattari Zambelli. She then became the first Asian footballer to play in Serie A. The club won Serie A for 2 years in a row. However, Reggiana was relegated due to financial strain. In 1993, she returned to Japan and joined Suzuyo Shimizu FC Lovely Ladies. However, the club was withdrew from Nadeshiko League end of 1998 season. The club was disbanded end of 1999 and she retired. On 22 October 1984, when Nagamine was 16 years old, she debuted for the Japan national team against Australia. She was a member of Japan for 1991 and 1995 World Cup. She also played at 1986, 1989, 1991, 1993, 1995 AFC Championship, 1990 and 1994 Asian Games. She played 64 games and scored 48 goals for Japan until 1996. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1984 1 0 1985 0 0 1986 13 12 1987 4 1 1988 3 1 1989 10 13 1990 6 7 1991 12 5 1992 0 0 1993 4 5 1994 5 2 1995 5 2 1996 1 0 Total 64 48 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Tokyo Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Tokyo Shidax LSC players Category:Suzuyo Shimizu FC Lovely Ladies players Category:1991 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1995 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1986 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1989 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1991 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1993 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1995 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1990 Asian Games Category:Footballers at the 1994 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1990 Asian Games Category:Medalists at the 1994 Asian Games
title: Kaori Nagamine
